projects.title: This Website (Every Line)
projects.summary: No templates, no CMS. Just hand-written HTML/CSS/JS, service worker, Savonie chat, and Lighthouse 90+ scores. The repo is the proof.

projects.title: L'Oréal Cell BioPrint MAPS Campaign
projects.summary: Class concept campaign deck for L'Oréal Cell BioPrint that maps three personas and their touchpoints across the funnel.

projects.title: Franklin Templeton Class Concept
projects.summary: 17-page class concept deck for a Franklin Templeton 'Voice of Progress' campaign.

projects.title: EndPoint LinkedIn Campaign
projects.summary: 15-page deck outlining Phase 2A and Phase 2B of an EndPoint LinkedIn retargeting campaign.

projects.title: Endpoint Elosity Launch Video
projects.summary: Motion storyboard and full voiceover script showing bottlenecks shattering into a clean trial timeline. Built for silent autoplay with bold typography.

projects.title: Taking Down Endpoint (Almac Group + 4G Clinical)
projects.summary: Marketing strategy deck proposing how Almac Group and 4G Clinical could position together against Endpoint Clinical.

hobbies.title: Gym & Strength Training
hobbies.summary: Building discipline through progressive overload. Tracking PRs, optimizing recovery, and proving that consistency beats intensity every time.

hobbies.title: Photography
hobbies.summary: Capturing moments worth remembering. iPhone shots that tell stories; no DSLR needed, just good lighting and better timing.

hobbies.title: Car Enthusiasm
hobbies.summary: First car, first freedom. Not about speed; about ownership, maintenance, and the pride of keeping something running clean.

hobbies.title: Cooking
hobbies.summary: Steak, pasta, and everything in between. Not a chef; just someone who refuses to eat mediocre food when good ingredients are available.

hobbies.title: Whispers (Sticky Notes)
hobbies.summary: Random thoughts captured on sticky notes. Ideas, observations, reminders. Low-tech brain dump that keeps the mental clutter organized.

hobbies.title: Reading
hobbies.summary: Books are compressed experience. Reading is the cheapest way to access decades of wisdom without making the same mistakes yourself.
